author: Andrew Rosati
description: The years President Javier Milei spent courting Donald Trump are paying off at a critical moment as he battles Argentina’s latest currency crisis.
title: Milei’s Bet on Trump Pays Off at Critical Moment for Argentina

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Iran will remain part of the Nuclear Proliferation Treaty, the country’s president said, despite the looming threat of renewed UN sanctions and a domestic push by some lawmakers to adopt a more aggressive posture.
title: Iran Says It Won’t Exit Nuclear Pact Despite Sanctions Snapback

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump called for Microsoft Corp. to fire Lisa Monaco, the company’s president of global affairs, the latest in a series of moves targeting former government officials he perceives as political opponents.
title: Trump Calls for Microsoft to Fire Former Biden Aide Lisa Monaco

author: Chris Strohm
description: The years-long conflict between President Donald Trump and former Federal Bureau of Investigation Director James Comey took a dramatic turn on Sept. 25, when Trump’s hand-picked US attorney in Virginia, Lindsey Halligan, brought an indictment against Comey for lying to lawmakers and obstructing a congressional proceeding in 2020.
title: How Trump’s Feud With Ex-FBI Chief Comey Led to an Indictment

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain was upgraded by Moody’s Ratings and Fitch Ratings, a double-whammy that recognizes the economy’s standout growth performance in the euro area.
title: Spain Wins Double Upgrade at Moody’s and Fitch on Strong Economy

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The US Supreme Court will allow the Trump administration to continue to freeze billions of dollars in foreign assistance funding poised to expire at the end of the month.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Keep Freeze on Expiring Foreign Aid

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s High-Priced Visas Take Aim at Legal Immigration

author: Roxana Tiron, Courtney McBride
description: National Guard troops deployed to Washington, DC for President Donald Trump’s “safe and beautiful mission” are set to keep working in the city, without pay, if the US government shuts down over a funding dispute between the White House and congressional Democrats.
title: National Guard Troops Deployed to DC Would Go Unpaid in Shutdown

author: Andreina Itriago, Eric Martin
description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro offered to help Donald Trump’s administration hunt down leaders of the Tren de Aragua drug cartel after the US deployed the military to carry out anti-narcotics strikes in the Caribbean.
title: Maduro Offers to Help Trump Hunt Feared Venezuelan Gang Leaders

author: Leah Nylen, Sabrina Willmer, Jimmy Jenkins
description: For the past four days, the Justice Department has sought to persuade a federal judge in Virginia to force Alphabet Inc.’s Google to sell off part of the company and change the way it does business to improve competition for online display advertising.
title: Google Ad Tech Under Fire: What the DOJ Wants a Judge to Do

author: Myles Miller
description: Shane Tamura, who carried out a fatal shooting attack at a Manhattan office tower housing the National Football League, showed evidence of early-stage degenerative brain disease tied to repeated blows to the head, according to New York City’s chief medical examiner.
title: NFL Office Shooter Had Low-Level CTE, NYC Medical Examiner Finds

author: Thomas Buckley
description: Sinclair Inc., one of two TV stations owners that dropped Jimmy Kimmel Live! over remarks its host made about the killing of activist Charlie Kirk, is putting the show back on the air.
title: Sinclair to Return Jimmy Kimmel’s Show Tonight, Disney Says

author: Michael O'Boyle, Maria Clara Cobo
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum rejected a request from magnate Ricardo Salinas to negotiate billions of dollars in tax claims the government alleges his companies owe.
title: Sheinbaum Won’t Negotiate Tax Bill With Billionaire Salinas

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump’s new tariffs on pharmaceutical imports will not apply to countries with negotiated agreements with the US that contain provisions on drugs, according to a White House official, delivering promised relief to economies including the European Union and Japan.
title: Trump’s 100% Pharmaceutical Tariffs Won’t Apply to the EU and Japan

author: Jim Wyss
description: Assata Shakur, a member of the Black Liberation Army who lived as a fugitive in Cuba for decades, drawing the ire of successive US administrations, has died on the communist-run island at age 78.
title: Assata Shakur, US Fugitive and Godmother to Tupac, Dies in Cuba

author: Kirsi Heikel, Patrick Donahue
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is broadening his effort to destabilize the West, forcing European leaders to reassess the scale of the threat and rush in new defenses.
title: Putin Is Ramping Up His Hybrid Campaign Against Europe

author: Ted Mann
description: The Trump administration’s threat to fire federal employees rather than furlough them in a possible government shutdown marks a further erosion of job security for a workforce that has already been upended by budget cuts and layoffs.
title: Trump’s Threat of Mass Firings Risks Lasting Shutdown Damage

author: Chris Strohm
description: Donald Trump notched a major victory in his push for legal action against perceived political enemies with the indictment of former FBI director James Comey, fueling speculation about possible charges against others the president wants prosecuted.
title: Comey Charges Further Enmesh DOJ in Trump’s Retribution Push

author: Chris Strohm
description: Donald Trump advanced his push for legal action against perceived political enemies with the indictment of former FBI director James Comey, heightening speculation about others the president wants prosecuted and concerns over the Justice Department’s independence.
title: Comey Charges Further Enmesh DOJ in Trump’s Retribution Push

author: Alex Wickham
description: On the eve of their annual party conference, Keir Starmer’s Labour Party allies were crying out for a new set of ideas to revive his flagging premiership.
title: Starmer’s Revival of Blair-Era Policy Fuels Doubts About Reset

author: Michael Nienaber, Vonnie Quinn
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz lamented the decline in respect for the rule of law worldwide, particularly in the US, in an unusually blunt message directed at a key ally.
title: Merz Criticizes State of US Democracy, Lack of Respect for Rules

author: Taonga Mitimingi, Matthew Hill
description: Zambia plans to cut its budget deficit to the lowest level since at least 2011, a rare move in an election year.
title: Zambia Seeks Lowest Budget Deficit Since 2011 in Vote Year

author: Antony Sguazzin, Loni Prinsloo
description: South Africa is considering a revised trade deal from the US and is hopeful it can agree terms that will ease the impact of 30% tariff imposed by the Trump administration, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.
title: South Africa Plans Response to New US Trade Proposal in Weeks

author: Annmarie Hordern, Paul Wallace
description: Egypt’s foreign minister said Arab states support US President Donald Trump’s latest push to end the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.
title: Egypt Says Arab States Back Trump Push to End War in Gaza

author: Frank Jomo
description: Malawi’s president-elect said he will prioritize reviving the struggling economy after returning to power and that he will urgently seek a new financing program with the International Monetary Fund.
title: Malawi President-Elect Targets Economic Revival, New IMF Program

author: Nicolle Yapur
description: The rebound in Argentine assets this week has been torrid. The peso has soared 10%, stocks have jumped 7% and the government’s foreign bonds have posted gains of 22%.
title: Argentina Debt Has Best Week Since 2022 on ‘Circuit Breaker’ Aid

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Dan Strumpf
description: A murder-for-hire plot in the US that authorities say involved an Indian government official included plans for an additional assassination in Nepal or Pakistan, prosecutors alleged in court documents.
title: US Prosecutors Allege India Agent Also Plotted Murder in Pakistan or Nepal

author: Arne Delfs
description: Germany said broader United Nations sanctions will be imposed on Iran after talks between European powers and the Islamic Republic failed to deliver a solution to their impasse over the country’s nuclear program.
title: Germany Says UN Will Sanction Iran After Fruitless Nuclear Talks

author: Kati Pohjanpalo, Jordan Robertson
description: Russia is waging two wars. The first is the live-fire conflict in Ukraine, the second a more covert affair targeting countries that support the government in Kyiv. The toolkit ranges from state-on-state cyberattacks, disinformation and propaganda to more visible tactics such as arson, sabotage and airspace incursions.
title: What Is Hybrid Warfare? How Is Russia Employing It?

author: Andrea Dudik
description: Support for the party of Czech billionaire Andrej Babis, the favorite to win Oct. 3-4 election, dropped to the lowest level this year in a sign that the race is tightening in the final days of the campaign.
title: Czech Election Favorite’s Lead Hits Lowest This Year, Poll Shows

author: Ewa Krukowska, Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz called on the European Union to give up its 2035 deadline to effectively ban combustion engines and instead allow the troubled car industry to pursue a softer path to climate neutrality.
title: Merz Urges EU to Lift Combustion Engine Ban as Industry Declines

author: Andrea Palasciano, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union proposed introducing tighter checks on Russian diplomats on the continent as the bloc works on a new round of sanctions to pressure Moscow to end its war against Ukraine.
title: EU Proposes Introduction of Tighter Checks for Russian Diplomats

author: Emily Flitter, Kriston Capps
description: An internal memo tells staff to focus on discrimination against individuals, not neighborhoods, in a potential threat to redlining cases.
title: Housing Department's Redlining Retreat Grants Mortgage Lenders a Reprieve

author: Zeke Faux, Muyao Shen
description: Justin Sun was facing an SEC fraud case, but $90 million of Trump coins later, he’s doing business with the president’s family.
title: A Crypto Billionaire’s Path From Pariah to Trump Moneyman

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Benjamin Netanyahu struck a defiant tone in his speech to the United Nations General Assembly, vowing to continue Israel’s war in Gaza until Hamas is destroyed and slamming Western countries that recognized Palestinian statehood in recent days.
title: Netanyahu Slams Western Countries Recognizing Palestinian State

author: Arne Delfs, Vonnie Quinn
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul said NATO is ready to defend its territory against any Russian incursion while also stressing that the military alliance has no desire to escalate conflict with the Kremlin.
title: Germany’s Top Diplomat Warns Russia Against Further Incursions

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson
description: Republican congressional leaders say they are searching for an off-ramp to the rapidly approaching US government shutdown but refuse to use a must-pass funding bill to address Democrats’ health-care priorities.
title: Thune Searches for Shutdown Off-Ramp to Bypass Schumer Blockade

author: Lucy White
description: The UK’s election watchdog said it will not reopen an investigation into undeclared donations received by the Labour Together think tank when it was being run by Morgan McSweeney, now Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s chief of staff.
title: UK Watchdog Rules Out Reopening Probe Into Starmer’s Top Aide

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is counting on BMW AG’s new electric-vehicle plant in the country’s east to bolster his political fortunes.
title: BMW’s New EV Plant Is a Prop for Orban’s Hungarian Election Bid

author: John Micklethwait, Sotiris Nikas
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said he’s in favor of cross-border bank consolidation in Europe and welcomes the investment by Italy’s UniCredit SpA in Alpha Bank SA.
title: Greek Premier in Favor of Cross-Border Bank Takeovers

author: Andras Gergely
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban threatened to severely punish those who make unfounded allegations against his cabinet, in a bid to deflect a scandal that may risk hurting his campaign for reelection next year.
title: Orban Vows Retribution as Hungarian Sex Abuse Scandal Widens

author: John Micklethwait, Viktoria Dendrinou
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said there is movement among European Union member states to issue joint debt to support a boost in defense spending in the bloc.
title: Greek Premier Says Support Growing for Joint EU Defense Debt

author: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Russia is increasingly relying on a large number of small sabotage groups to pierce through Ukrainian positions as its summer offensive struggles to make significant headway, according to Ukraine’s top military commander.
title: Ukraine Says Russia Using Sabotage Tactics in Stalled Offensive

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Eltaf Najafizada
description: India said Friday that both the Indian and US economies have benefited significantly from the movement of skilled talent, days after President Donald Trump’s decision to impose severe restrictions on H-1B visas.
title: India Defends Skilled Worker Flow as Trump Tightens H-1B Rules

author: Ishika Mookerjee
description: Singapore’s healthcare regulator said there is no conclusive scientific evidence linking paracetamol use during pregnancy to autism in children, refuting recent assertions made by US President Donald Trump.
title: Singapore Refutes Trump Claim Linking Paracetamol and Autism

author: Katarina Hoije
description: A World Bank arbitration body ordered Niger to refrain from trading Orano SA’s uranium from the Somaïr mine that the West African nation’s junta seized from the French nuclear-power company earlier this year.
title: World Bank Tribunal Bars Niger Uranium Sales from Somaïr Mine

author: Daniel Flatley, Enda Curran
description: The Trump administration’s $20 billion lifeline for Argentina leans on a Treasury fund that’s been successfully used to bail out troubled allies in the past – but it could still carry risks for US taxpayers.
title: Bessent Puts US Money at Risk in $20 Billion Argentina Backstop

description: Lord Menzies Campbell, former leader of the Liberal Democrats, has died at the age of 84.
title: Former Lib DEM Leader Ming Campbell Dies Aged 84

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: India said it held “constructive meetings” with the US this week on a trade deal, although Washington’s demand that New Delhi stop buying Russian oil is weighing on the negotiations.
title: US Insists India Halt Russia Oil Purchases to Secure Trade Deal

author: Wes Kosova
description: At the General Assembly, world leaders who appeased the US president’s NATO and tariff demands are defying him on climate change, energy and other urgent issues.
title: The UN Shows How Trump Is Pretty Much on His Own Now

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Inequality and endemic corruption has prompted many Filipinos to take to the streets.
title: Asia’s Protest Wave Sweeps Over the Philippines

author: Nayla Razzouk
description: Farmers staged protests across France, urging the government to block a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations and protect them from what they say will be unfair competition.
title: French Farmers Protest With Tractors Over EU-Mercosur Trade Pact

author: Patrick Sykes
description: Iran’s parliament will on Sunday debate a letter by its members calling for a change in the country’s stated policy of not pursuing nuclear weapons, raising the stakes in the diplomatic showdown over Tehran’s atomic work ahead of a key UN vote.
title: Iran’s Parliament to Debate Changing Peaceful Nuclear Doctrine

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: European Union ambassadors will begin discussions on Friday on a plan to provide Ukraine with €140 billion ($164 billion) in fresh loans using frozen Russian Central Bank assets.
title: EU to Discuss €140 Billion Ukraine Loan Plan Using Russia Assets

author: Lucy White
description: Nigel Farage would be in pole position to become the UK’s next prime minister if an election were held tomorrow, according to new polling which shows his upstart Reform party would wipe out Labour’s overwhelming majority from 2024.
title: Farage on Track to Become UK Prime Minister, YouGov Projects

author: Andras Gergely
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban openly pushed back against US President Donald Trump, digging in his heels over purchases of Russian energy.
title: Hungary’s Orban Refuses to Budge on Trump Russian Energy Demand

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: The Netherlands has signed a memorandum of understanding with Uganda to deport rejected asylum seekers via the African country, as it seeks to assuage voter unrest over immigration.
title: Netherlands Signs Pact to Send Rejected Asylum Seekers to Uganda

author: Kate Sullivan, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: President Donald Trump urged Turkey to curb energy imports from Russia, warning that US sales of stealth fighter jets to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization ally depend on Ankara’s support for American goals.
title: Trump Presses Erdogan on Russian Oil in ‘Conclusive’ Meeting

author: Sanne Wass, Christian Wienberg
description: Denmark’s Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen warned Danes to brace for more hybrid attacks, pointing to Russia as Europe’s main security threat, just before a suspected drone sighting disrupted air traffic in Denmark for the third time in a week.
title: Denmark Warns Russian Sabotage Likely as Another Drone Suspected

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia is facing an explosion in the tobacco black market that’s now the country’s biggest public-health threat, Health Minister Mark Butler said Friday, warning the government plans a major crackdown to prosecute offenders.
title: Booming Black Market for Tobacco Prompts Crackdown in Australia

author: Naomi Tajitsu, Alice Atkins, Alice Gledhill
description: When the ruling Labour Party’s politicians and members gather for their annual conference next week, there will be another crucial audience to think about: the UK bond market.
title: The Bond Market Will Be Looming  Large Over Labour’s Party Conference

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Myanmar’s junta chief Min Aung Hlaing held talks in Moscow about deepening diplomatic, defense, energy and investment ties.
title: Putin, Myanmar Junta Chief Discuss Deepening Ties in Moscow

author: Irina Vilcu, Maxim Edwards
description: Russia is trying to bring the former Soviet state back into its sphere of influence while European leaders are promising EU membership.
title: Putin and Poverty Divide Voters as Moldova Plots Path to Europe

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Pedro Sanchez and his team were sat on their government jet waiting for take off when Donald Trump let rip.
title: Sanchez Sets Out to Turn Spain’s Economic Success Into Votes

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: Leaders from some of South Africa’s biggest companies said a partnership with the country’s government has helped the economy avoid “potential failure.”
title: Business Leaders Says Partnership Avoided South Africa’s Failure

author: Ashleigh Furlong
description: The UK is pushing ahead on regulations for artificial intelligence in health care, creating a national commission to help the country attract health-tech investment and make the most of the AI revolution.
title: UK Seeks AI Rules to Spur Health-Care Overhaul, Protect Patients

author: Kok Leong Chan
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will attend the Association of Southeast Asian Nations summit in October as the North American country and the regional bloc seek to conclude a free trade agreement next year.
title: Carney to Attend Asean Summit as Canada Seeks Trade Deal in 2026

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said North Korea has already secured sufficient nuclear weapons to guarantee regime survival, and is nearing completion of intercontinental ballistic missile technology capable of reaching the US.
title: S. Korea’s Lee Says North Has Enough Nuclear Arms for Survival
